H0.text: Alternation of generation is the reason why the life cycle of plants is so complex.

H1.text: Metamorphosis is the reason the life cycle of plants is so complex.

H2.text: The pollination process explains why the life cycle of plants is so complex.

H3.text: Asexual reproduction is part of what makes the life cycle of plants so complex.

A4.text: Plant life cycles can be complex. Alternation of generations can take place in plants which are at once heteromorphic, sporophytic, oogametic, dioicous, heterosporic and dioecious, such as in a willow tree (as most species of the genus Salix are dioecious).

A5.text: The relationship between the sporophyte and gametophyte phases varies among different groups of plants.
